intro: Barlia longibracteata, commonly known as the long-bract barlia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. Barlia longibracteata typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
